data.title: October update: should you buy or sell Apple shares?
data.text: The US stock market is pressured by the latest news that US President Donald Trump and wife Melania contracted COVID-19. The price of Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) stock has weakened from $137 below $104 in less than several weeks and the current price stands around $113.

data.title: Pete Najarian's top buys: Datadog, Apple, Nvidia
data.text: Pete Najarian, MarketRebellion.com co-founder, joins 'Fast Money Halftime Report' to talk about his top stock picks. He also talks about how the news of President Trump testing positive for Covid-19 will impact FAANG stocks.

data.title: 7 Overvalued Stocks Investors Should Sell This October
data.text: These seven stocks have outrun their valuations and are worth watching from the sidelines until a significant pullback takes their share prices back down to earth. The post 7 Overvalued Stocks Investors Should Sell This October appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Big Tech Breakups: Dream On
data.text: Congress is, once again, attempting to find ways to control Big Tech and even break up some of the platforms that serve the modern world.

data.title: Why Apple Stock Lost 10% Last Month
data.text: Shares of the iPhone maker pulled back after its stock split at the end of August.

data.title: Apple's TV Box Is Less Relevant Than Ever
data.text: The Apple TV app is far more important than the Apple TV set-top box.

data.title: 7 Artificial Intelligence Stocks to Buy for October
data.text: While the pandemic has been an awful development for all of us, on the flipside, it has demonstrated the growing importance of artificial intelligence stocks. The post 7 Artificial Intelligence Stocks to Buy for October appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Should Peloton Investors Worry About Apple's New Fitness Service?
data.text: Apple is planning to leverage its massive installed base of devices to capture a big slice of this growing market.

data.title: 5 Stocks to Play the Upcoming Election
data.text: Investors trying to pick election stocks should look at names that are likely to perform well no matter who occupies 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue. The post 5 Stocks to Play the Upcoming Election appeared first on InvestorPlace.
